content.title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
content.statement: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Psychiatry that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
